title: The Other Way Covid Will Kill: Hunger
summary: Worldwide, the population facing life-threatening levels of food insecurity is expected to double, to more than a quarter of a billion people.

title: The Age of Electric Cars Is Dawning Ahead of Schedule
summary: Battery prices are dropping faster than expected. Analysts are moving up projections of when an electric vehicle won’t need government incentives to be cheaper than a gasoline model.

title: U.S. and European Oil Giants Go Different Ways on Climate Change
summary: While BP and other European companies invest billions in renewable energy, Exxon and Chevron are committed to fossil fuels and betting on moonshots.

title: Climate change? U.S. oil giants are doubling down on fossil fuels.
summary: By Clifford Krauss

title: China Is on a Building Binge, and Metal Prices Are Surging
summary: Iron ore, nickel, copper and other metal prices are rising as China restarts construction, and the global economy could benefit.

title: Britain Is Getting Ready for Its Space Race
summary: Spurred by Brexit, London is backing companies that will build satellites and haul them into orbit.

title: Takeaways from the congressional report on Big Tech.
summary: By The New York Times

title: A Columnist Makes Sense of Wall Street Like None Other (See Footnote)
summary: Finance journalism isn’t known for its writerly voices. Matt Levine, the author of Money Stuff, is an oddball exception.

title: Spotify, Solar Power and Beer Cans: How 3 Investors Beat the Market
summary: Managers of three of the third quarter’s top-performing mutual funds bet on a music streamer, a solar-panel installer and a beverage-can maker.

title: Chevron’s Purchase Could Unlock Israel’s Natural Gas Bonanza
summary: The oil giant’s takeover of Noble Energy gives it a foothold in an emerging energy hot spot: the eastern Mediterranean Sea.

title: Value Stocks May Offer Best Prospects in Emerging Markets
summary: Many stocks in developing nations have underperformed for years, but they could thrive in a post-pandemic world.

title: Trump Holds Indoor Rally as White House Officials Try to Defend His Virus Response
summary: Infections in Britain have spiked back up to levels not seen in months. After a fire razed a refugee camp in Greece, homeless migrants fear what’s next.

title: Cuba’s Economy Was Hurting. The Pandemic Brought a Food Crisis.
summary: The island was able to control the coronavirus, but the dearth of tourists in the pandemic’s wake strangled an economy already damaged by mismanagement and U.S. sanctions.

title: Coronavirus Upends College Admissions Tests, Creating Chaos for Students
summary: An Iowa school district that defied a reopening order is moving toward a “hybrid” model. South Korea suspends a plan to provide free flu shots to 19 million people.

title: Trudeau Promises Bold Plan to Reset Canada, and His Political Career
summary: The prime minister promised dramatic actions to fix the economy and more as Parliament resumes. But his agenda is short on detail.

title: Stalled Talks Over Covid-19 Stimulus in the U.S. Show Signs of Life
summary: It was far from clear that Republican and Democratic negotiators would be able to reach a deal. Rio de Janeiro’s annual Carnival parade will be delayed for the first time in decades.

title: Kim Jong-un Offers South Korea Rare Apology for Killing of Official
summary: “I am deeply sorry that an unexpected and unfortunate thing has happened in our territorial waters,” the North Korean leader said in a message, according to officials in the South.

title: Justin Trudeau Offers Wide Array of Promises With Few Specifics
summary: The prime minister laid out an ambitious legislative agenda without saying much about what it will cost or how he will pay for it.

title: Trump’s positive cause global markets to tumble.
summary: By Carlos Tejada

title: Hopes Fade for New Political Course in Algeria a Year After Popular Uprising
summary: “We are moving backward fast,” said a leading figure in protests last year that ousted the country’s authoritarian ruler.

title: Indonesia’s Parliament Approves Jobs Bill, Despite Labor and Environmental Fears
summary: Parliament moved up a vote on the coronavirus stimulus bill after unions called for a national strike. Critics say it will relax rules to prevent deforestation and protect workers.

title: Venezuela, Once an Oil Giant, Reaches the End of an Era
summary: Venezuela’s oil reserves, the world’s largest, transformed the country and the global energy market. Now its oil sector is grinding to a halt. Will it ever recover?
